name: fortinet-fortirecon-brand-protection
label: Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection
description: FortiRecon is a Digital Risk Protection Service (DRPS) product that provides an outside-the-network view to the risks posed to your enterprise.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.description: API key to access the endpoint to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: org_id
fields.title: Organization ID
fields.description: The organization ID on which FortiRecon operations are to be performed.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Search Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves a list of alerts(reports) published by FortiRecon based on the filter criteria like tags, adversary, relevance, and any other details you have specified.

parameters.name: relevance_rating
parameters.title: Relevance Rating
parameters.tooltip: Specify a relevance rating to filter the alerts. Separate multiple relevance ratings using a comma. For example, Medium, High, Low.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a relevance rating to filter the alerts. Separate multiple relevance ratings using a comma. For example, Medium, High, Low.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Specify a tag to filter the alerts. Separate multiple relevance ratings using a comma. For example, phishing, malware, exploited.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a tag to filter the alerts. Separate multiple relevance ratings using a comma. For example, phishing, malware, exploited.

parameters.name: adversary
parameters.title: Adversary
parameters.tooltip: Specify an adversary(actor names, APT groups) to filter the alerts. Separate multiple adversaries using a comma. For example, apt35, foo, bar.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an adversary(actor names, APT groups) to filter the alerts. Separate multiple adversaries using a comma. For example, apt35, foo, bar.

parameters.name: source_category
parameters.title: Source Category
parameters.tooltip: Select a source category from the following options to filter the alerts
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a source category from the following options to filter the alerts: Darknet, OSINT,Technical Intelligence

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.title: Report Type
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select a report from the following options type to filter the alerts.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a report from the following options type to filter the alerts. Flash Report ,Flash Alert

parameters.name: industry
parameters.title: Industry
parameters.tooltip: Specify an industry to filter the alerts. Separate multiple industries using a comma. For example, manufacturing, government, and hospitality.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an industry to filter the alerts. Separate multiple industries using a comma. For example, manufacturing, government, and hospitality.

parameters.name: geography
parameters.title: Geography
parameters.placeholder: example: south america,western europe, east asia,africa.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a geography to filter the alerts. Separate multiple geographies using a comma. For example, South America, Western Europe, East Asia, and Africa.
parameters.description: Optional) Specify a geography to filter the alerts. Separate multiple geographies using a comma. For example, South America, Western Europe, East Asia, and Africa.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to filter the alerts. Separate multiple geographies using a comma. Some example keywords are Report ID, Report Title, Report Summary, Report Content, Source Category. Actors, Motivation, Threats, and Industry Tags.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to filter the alerts. Separate multiple geographies using a comma. Some example keywords are Report ID, Report Title, Report Summary, Report Content, Source Category. Actors, Motivation, Threats, and Industry Tags.

parameters.name: source_reliability
parameters.title: Source Reliability
parameters.tooltip: Select a source reliability from the following options to filter the alerts.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a source reliability from the following options to filter the alerts:  A-Reliable, B-Usually reliable, C-Fairly reliable, D-Not usually reliable, E-Unreliable, F-Cannot be judged

parameters.name: information_reliability
parameters.title: Information Reliability
parameters.tooltip: Select an information reliability from the following options to filter the alerts.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select an information reliability from the following options to filter the alerts:  1-Confirmed, 2-Probably true, 3-Possibly true, 4-Doubtfully true, 5-Improbable, 6-Cannot be judged

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the range from when you want to retrieve the report.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the range from when you want to retrieve the report.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the range from when you want to retrieve the report.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the range from when you want to retrieve the report.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records that the operation should include for the current page.

operations.title: Get Alert Details By Alert ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of an alert based on the alert ID you have specified

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the alert ID of the alert to get its details.
parameters.description: Specify the alert ID of the alert to get its details.

operations.title: Get Phishing Campaigns
operations.description: Retrieves a list of phishing campaigns discovered by FortiRecon's Watermarks for the given organization.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records that the operation should include for the current page.

operations.title: Get Phishing Campaigns By ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of a phishing attempt discovered by FortiRecon based on the ID you have specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Phishing Campaign ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the phishing attempt to get its details.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the phishing attempt to get its details.

operations.title: Get Rogue Apps
operations.description: Retrieves a list of Rogue Apps based on the status and keywords that you have specified for the query; rogue apps are mobile applications trying to look like apps from trusted brands.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the rogue app's status type from the following options to filter the results:  Official: Apps published by officially recognized users, Unofficial:Apps published by users that are not recognized officially, RogueApps: Apps published by known malicious actors or deemed to be potentially malicious.
parameters.tooltip: Select the rogue app's status type from the following options to filter the results.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify the keywords to filter the results. For example: Source Name, Developer Name, App Name.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the keywords to filter the results. For example: Source Name, Developer Name, App Name.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records that the operation should include for the current page.

operations.title: Get Rogue App By ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of a rogue app based on the Rogue App ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Rogue App ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify an ID of the rogue app to get its details.
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the rogue app to get its details.

operations.title: Get Takedown Requests
operations.description: Retrieves a list of takedown requests for rogue apps and typo domains for the given organization.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select the take-down request status from the following options to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the take-down request status from the following options to filter the results: Requested, Acknowledged, Initiated, Closed.

parameters.name: category
parameters.title: Category
parameters.tooltip: Select the take-down request category from the following options to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the take-down request category from the following options to filter the results:  Phishing, Fraudulentdomains, Typosquatting, RogueApps, Alert.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the keywords to filter the results. For example: ticketId, entity (It may be a domain name, the title of a report, Phished Domain, etc)
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the keywords to filter the results. For example: ticketId, entity (It may be a domain name, the title of a report, Phished Domain, etc)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the range when the takedown was requested; default is last 6 months.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the range when the takedown was requested; default is last 6 months.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the range when the takedown was requested; default is today's date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the range when the takedown was requested; default is today's date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records that the operation should include for the current page.

operations.title: Get Typo Domains
operations.description: Retrieves a list of typo domains discovered by FortiRecon for the given organization; also called Typosquatting, URL hijacking, sting site, or a fake URL is a form of cybersquatting where malicious actors register and use an internet domain similar to an organization's trademarks, service marks, company names, or personal names.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select the domain status from the following options to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the domain status from the following options to filter the results: Non-Functional,Offline,Online.

parameters.name: original_domain
parameters.title: Original Domain
parameters.tooltip: Specify the original domain name to filter the results. Multiple domains should be comma separated. For example, example.com, test.com
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the original domain name to filter the results. Multiple domains should be comma separated. For example, example.com, test.com

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify keywords to filter the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify keywords to filter the results. For example, example

parameters.name: severity
parameters.title: Severity
parameters.tooltip: Specify the severity of the request to filter the results. Severity can range from 0 to 100.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the severity of the request to filter the results. Severity can range from 0 to 100. For example: 50to80, 0to80S.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the date range to filter the results based on the date found in the whois record for that domain. Default is last 6 months.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the date range to filter the results based on the date found in the whois record for that domain. Default is last 6 months.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the date range to filter the results based on the date found in the whois record for that domain. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the date range to filter the results based on the date found in the whois record for that domain. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the records.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records that the operation should include for the current page.

operations.title: Get Typo Domain By ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of a typo domain based on the typo domain ID you have specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Typo Domain ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the typo domain to get its details.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the typo domain to get its details.
